name: Kuredu Island Resort & Spa

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Arrived into Male on the BA Gatwick flight and a no hassle check in with the seaplane company.
reviews.title: A real tonic for everyone!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: A short bus round the other side of the airport and a short wait led us onto the seaplane and what began 10 nights of sheer bliss.
reviews.title: Pretty close to Paradise

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled with family
reviews.text: The views from the 40 minute seaplane trip were awesome, i recommend sitting on the left hand side of the plane to ge the best views, also have your camera ready.
reviews.title: Paradise - Great for the family!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: A warm friendly welcome on the jetty led us into check in at Akiri bar and then shown the main restuarants for a spot of delicious lunch and then off to our jacuzzi beach villa.
reviews.title: Paradise

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our cases were waiting for us and a quick freshen up and unpack and we started exploring our new home for 10 nights.
reviews.title: Absolute paradise; all the frills and zero faults!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Just got back from a week in Kuredu and have to say it was worth every penny. The flight was very long and feeling tired, but as soon as you arrive on the island via sea plane it is amazing. The views and golden sand are fantastic. We had booked a beach bungalow, which was very nice and comfortable. You are assigned one restaurant if in this accomdation and have to say this was the best food I have ever tasted. First night had some hong kong pork that was to die for (might go back just for this) and the staff in the bonthi are so attentive (This was the name of the restaurant).
reviews.title: Perfect honeymoon destination

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: As it was our honeymoon we thought we had to try out the water villas (this was an extra $255 a night), but again well worth it. Waking up in the morning to the views and small sharks swimming underneath you. The only issue with this was the mosquitos, although we didn't se any on our stay (they do smoke the island to try to keep these to a minimum), we did ake up in the morning with several large bites on us. So definitely take repellent.
reviews.title: Amazing place!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Food within the sangu restaurant was very good but not nearly as nice as the bonthi and the service was much lower. Had to wait for a minute before my water glass was filled up :), whereas in the bonthi this was done before it was even empty. Also there didn't seem as much choice in the more exclusive restaurants. However i would still recommend upgrading to anyone.
reviews.title: Total paradise - but ensure you get O Beach Villa

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We also tried the jacuzzi villas for our last 2 nights at $165 a night, (we thought about O villas at $90 a night). This again was very nice and very relaxing.
reviews.title: Go!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: All staff at each of the rooms were excellent and room was always spotless, apart from the occassional gecko outside.
reviews.title: Honeymoon in paradise

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This was an amazing holiday from start to finish, Kuredu is a beautiful island it is the biggest island and that is why we chose it for a variety of things to do in the evening, it was brillliant the entertainment in the evening was as busy or as quiet as you liked, we spent a lot of time up at the 'O' Bar because it was near to our room and a lovely breeze from the sea in the eveing, it was the quieter option. Although the main areas entertainment was really good. We had a Jacuzzi Beach Villa on the south side of the island it was perfect, cannot fault. The food was excellent, with choices for all tastes.
reviews.title: AMAZING

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We wouldn't hesitate to go back and indeed will some day.
reviews.title: It will amaze you on Keredu!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The sea plane transfer is an experience but the views when up are gobsmaking.
reviews.title: like a different world!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: If you have the chance to go to this beautiful part of the world then Go.
reviews.title: Barefoot Bliss

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We arrived here on Thursday 19th August for 6 nights before heading for a tour of Sri Lanka. When you go through immigration at the airport you go to the Kuredu booth to arrange your sea plane transfer to Kuredu. The flight takes approx 50 minutes and it is fantastic to see the Atolls below. Try and get a window seat if possible, as the views are amazing.
reviews.title: A truly fabulous island

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This place is wonderful!!
reviews.title: Perfect! Perfect! Perfect!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed in a Sangu Water Villa (all inclusive) and it was fantastic.
reviews.title: Honeymoon...what honeymoon

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled with family
reviews.text: The service all over the island was superb, everyone is so friendly. The restaurant staff were great and always make sure you have enough water etc. THE FOOD WAS EXCELLENT!!
reviews.title: PARADISE

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: They really go the extra mile; the room boy cleaned our room twice a day and was very pleasant man.
reviews.title: All that we expected and more!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: You are treated like royalty from the moment you land.
reviews.title: The most relaxing holiday ever.

description: Perched atop northern reef of Lhaviyani Atoll, Kuredu Island Resort celebrates twenty-five years of meritorious service to it’s guests. This large resort offers a range of options with seven restaurants, seven bars, nine categories of accommodation, sports and leisure activities. The resort operates single largest dive centre in Maldives. Kuredu Golf Club is the first golf club in Maldives and is still the largest. With 85% of the resort retained as nature, eco friendliness in operation has won international accolades. Be your holiday romantic, diving, golfing, sheer chill out, culinary exploration, Kuredu is the natural choice.Kuredu ... ... ... pure as silver, good as paradise!
